title: [Fix](Nereids) fix leading hint dealing with big brace
body:
## Proposed changes

Problem:
when we use leading as leading({t1 t2} {t3 t4}) it mistake it as leading (t1 t2 t3 t4)
Causes:
when leading hint algorithm meet big brace it would increase level or decrease level of table, when "}{" get together it
would reset level, so t2 and t3 would set to same level
Solved:
when we meet "}{" let the level of t3 add with 2, then it would be like leading({t1 t2}{{t3 t4}}) when dealing with levels

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](Job)Concurrency may result in event loss
body:
## Proposed changes

Our previous internal scheduling was single-threaded, without concurrency, so we adopted the single-producer mode, but later provided an external trigger method. At this time, concurrency would occasionally occur, resulting in message loss. Now we have switched to multi-producer, which is used by the bottom layer CAS controls concurrency

<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [improvement](disk) pick disk randomly when usage is less than 0.7
body:
## Proposed changes

When creating a tablet, firstly we try to pick a disk from disks whose usage is below 70% randomly. If all disks are beyonds 70%, then we try to pick a disk from disks whose usage is below 85% randomly. If all disks are beyond 85%, then we try to pick a disk from them randomly.
Issue Number: close #xxx

title: [fix](expr) Re fix BE core dump while common expr filter delete condition column
body:
## Proposed changes

Additional deleted filter condition will be materialized column be at the end of the block,
after _output_column_by_sel_idx  will be erase, we not need to filter it,
so erase it from _columns_to_filter in the first next_batch.
Eg:
      `delete from table where a = 10;`
      `select b from table;`
 a column only effective in segment iterator, the block from query engine only contain the b column,
 so no need to filter a column by expr.

title: [feature](inverted index)write separated index files in RAM directory…
body:
… to reduce IO(#28810)

Normally we write the separate index files to disk before we merge the index files into an idx compound file. In high-frequency load scenarios, disk IO can become a bottleneck. In order to reduce the pressure on the disk, we write the standalone index file to the RAM directory for the first time, and then write it to the disk when merging it into a composite file.

Add config `index_inverted_index_by_ram_dir_enable`, default is `false`.

## Proposed changes

pick from master #28810
<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

body:
## Proposed changes
1. we need  remove BE kinit, and use jni login with keytab, because kinit cannot renew TGT for doris in many complex cases.
> This pull requet will support new instance from keytab: https://github.com/apache/doris-thirdparty/pull/173, so now we  won't need kinit cmd, just login with keytab and principal

2. add `kerberos_ccache_path` to set kerberos credentials cache path manually.

3. add `max_hdfs_file_handle_cache_time_ms` to set hdfs fs handle cache time.
